content.description: This problem has clearly been done before, so feel free to contribute name/grade/FA information. Start on an undercling with a good left hand hold and bad foot holds, and make a few moves to the top.
content.location:
It is located about 10 feet to the right of the

V6

.

content.description:
Start as far left as you can on the south side of the boulder (facing the trail) with your left hand on the arete low and your right hand on an undercling. Jump to the lip or climb through small crimps.

A beta video:

https://youtu.be/s8DTPVWfvVY

.
content.location: It is on the farthest left (west) side of the boulder facing the trail (south).

content.description:
I thought this should have its own page on here. It's definitely been done before, but I'm not sure who by or when. Have at it in the comments if you know and would like to rename it and assess the grade.

This is a nice warm-up for the harder routes in the area. Start seated on two jugs, and work your way up the arete for a slightly spicy topout.

Start sitting with low underclings. Move your left hand into the left hand undercling for the stand. Then move right hand to the horrible, right hand slimper for the stand. Jump!

Beta video:

https://youtu.be/yCkdGp5-qzU

.
content.location: Begin sitting on the far left side of the long boulder, just right if the arete on the southwest corner.

content.description:
Start with your left hand on an undercling low, your right hand on a terrible slimper, your right toe on, and left heel hook. Dyno for the lip.

A beta video:

https://youtu.be/tnPz6gctsH8

.
content.location: It is on the far southwest side of the boulder facing south towards the trail about 6 feet to the right of the arete.

content.description:
I thought this should have its own page on here. It's definitely been done before, but I'm not sure who by or when. Have at it in the comments if you know and would like to rename it and assess the grade.

Start seated using a right hand sidepull crimp and a left hand jug. Move left through the slopey jugs to a decent crimp in the middle. Then it is dealer's choice for the big move to the holds below the lip.
content.location:
It is directly to the right of

Hardship

, V10.
